title: Out-of-bounds index in typechecker

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.
http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/
-->

Discovered while attempting set 2, challenge 10 of the cryptopals.com challenges.

### Code

#### Cargo.toml

```toml
[package]
name = "set2"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"

# See more keys and their definitions at https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html

[dependencies]
aes = { version = "0.8.2" }
cbc = { version = "0.1.2", features = ["alloc"] }
```

#### src/challenge10.rs

```Rust
// set 2, challenge 10

use aes::cipher::{BlockDecryptMut, BlockEncryptMut, KeyIvInit};
use aes::cipher::block_padding::Pkcs7;

use cbc;

pub type Aes128CbcEnc = cbc::Encryptor<aes::Aes128>;
pub type Aes128CbcDec = cbc::Decryptor<aes::Aes128>;

pub const KEY: [u8; 16] = *b"YELLOW SUBMARINE";
pub const IV: [u8; 16] = [0x00; 16];

fn cbc_decrypt_file(path: &str) -> Vec<u8> {
    let ciphertext = std::fs::read_to_string(path)
        .expect("Expected valid file path");
    let plaintext = Aes128CbcDec::new(&KEY.into(), &IV.into())
        .decrypt_padded_vec_mut::<Pkcs7>(ciphertext)
        .unwrap();

    let mut result = Vec::with_capacity(plaintext.len());
    result.copy_from_slice(plaintext);
    result
}

#[cfg(test)]
mod test {
    use super::*;

    #[test]
    fn try_cbc_decryption() {
        let plaintext = cbc_decrypt_file("./10.txt");
    
        println!("{:?}", plaintext);
    }
}
```

#### 10.txt

Obtained via `curl -o src/10.txt https://cryptopals.com/static/challenge-data/10.txt`


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.69.0-nightly (065852def 2023-02-13)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 065852def0903296da33a9eaf557f230bcf3a61a
commit-date: 2023-02-13
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.69.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.7
```

  |                                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

18  |         .decrypt_padded_vec_mut::<Pkcs7>(ciphertext)
    |          ------------------------------- ^^^^^^^^^^ expected `&[u8]`, found `String`
    |          |
    |          arguments to this method are incorrect

error: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.69.0-nightly (065852def 2023-02-13) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

   = note: this error originates in the macro `assert_eq` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
